commit_list.message:
tense fix

The past participle of "to run" is just "run".  "Ran" is the simple past tense.  For example:

* The program *ran* without errors.
* The program has been *run* dozens of times.

commit_list.message:
minor syntactic fix (#10)

(What follows is an observation that is hoped to be helpful, though it may not be an iron-clad rule, since English is a hodgepodge of many languages, and therefore not very consistent.  Also, it's just an off-the-cuff observation, rather than one I read in a grammar book that has been tested by generations of grammarians.  Nonetheless...)  "than" is used for contrasts, like "a Crystal app takes less CPU power than a Ruby app", or "Ruby is cooler than Java", etc., but "as" goes in phrases following the words "the same", and often other phrases where similarity is expressed.  For instance, "Crystal syntax is as easy to learn *as* Ruby syntax, but the executables run much faster *than* Ruby scripts."

commit_list.message:
fixed article

Since "Haml" begins with an aspiration (a puff of air, to avoid phonetic terms, as in "horse"), the indefinite article should be "a" not "an" (just as we say "a horse" rather than "an horse").

commit_list.message: cleaned up the README
cleaned up unit tests
fixing various links and routing issues, esp. bugs involving :ids and :section_ids
oh, and routes--I changed routes in the last commit but forgot to mention it\n\nI just added some whitespace for this one so I could add a commit message
changed comment_controller to work better with sections\n\nadded before_filter to get @section and changed code to get stories relative to sections
uncommented belongs_to :section, with optimism that I'll fix the bug that is mysteriously causing
I should have broken this up into several more atomic commits... I'm still getting the hang of it...
why don`t they make changes to .gitignore automatically added & commited! ? they`re not regular project files
cleaning up some old junk that should have been removed long ago
added some tests...
flash messages in partial

commented out association with :section in story.rb and the bug disappeared (under the rug for now) and commented out date validation since it's complaining about valid dates, and tested the other validation in story.rb

added validation to Story but can't test because of a bug related to sections 'Section(#31380870) expected, got String(#113650)' which I think has to do with the association betwen Story and Section and the fact that I have a section field in story...
got section tab highlighting working (using a smelly workaround of putting an if statement in the view)

tried to get autocompletion working... but no dice... might switch to doing it with jQuery earlier than planned... since the supposedly easy solution doesn't work, and jQuery hasn't let me down so far...

added section_id to story and added associations to models (whoops! forgot those before!) ... also fixed some problems with the dynamically generated tabs... @sections was not available everywhere... now it is, but in a very WET fashion... refactor that later
forgot modified files on last commit

got section tabs to be generated dynamically from Section objects (and got those to work with some voodoo programming: I did rake db:rollback and rake db:migrate and all the problems went away with no code changes!  apparently sqlite hiccupped when it first created the table or something!) but I can't get the dynamic highlighting working for the current section, and haven't gotten the routing working for sections yet, or the finders for sections

stub out healthService

for some reason these tests were preventing the health service
from being injected, and so the healthService.start() call failed,

the solution was to stub out the healthService, since it was not

commit_list.message:
don't check health during Capybara tests

dozens of previously-written tests assumed that there would be
nothing else sending out AJAX requests while those tests were
running.  That probably seemed like a safe assumption at the time,
but since we're checking the server's health, those tests are now
broken.  This restores their ability to make that assumption.

commit_list.message:
Require pdf source file on manuscript upload card

APERTA-8133

* On the manuscript upload card, if the file type of the uploaded
manuscript is PDF, require a backing source file of the types doc, docx,
zip, or tex.

* Wait for the user to upload a source file in the above case, instead
of the previous behavior of auto-completing the card after the
manuscript upload completes

* Change s3_dir and file columns in versioned text to be
manuscript_s3_path and manuscript_filename, then add new columns for
sourcefiles: sourcefile_s3_path and sourcefile_filename

* Populate the new columns appropriately after the source file is
uploaded to S3.

* Add a new attachment row for source files with the ruby class
SourceFileAttachment

  Update FactoryGuy fixtures for author and authors-task to include nested-questions.
  Update task-base component to skip validateData when it is skipping validations.
  Log a console.error(...) rather than die if a nested-question answer cannot be found on the authors-task, authors, or group-author components.

commit_list.message:
switch to flat early_posting key-value pair

previously we were generating
early_article_posting

"early_article_posting": {
  "consent": true,
},

but since we're no longer including the statement, this is unnecessary.
it's also going to be much harder to return this with consent: false
when there's no data to serialize.  making it a flat key/value pair
solves both problems.

commit_list.message:
Spike: Etching in a Site Admin role that has a wildcard permission.

The wildcard is intended to give them all permissions. This approach allows site admins to short-circuit additional permission queries.

We could remove the short-circuit logic and explicitly assign all of the permissions in the system to the Site Admin role, but given the scope of access this may produce unnecessary queries. This option seems simpler for the time being and more performant.

Paired with Zach Dennis (@zdennis)

APERTA-7504
commit_list.repo_description: A platform for managing the submission and review of research outputs

commit_list.message:
Etching in the basics of explicitly having System represented as a model.

This is so a user can be assigned to the System in a consistent data-driven manner as anything else.

Paired with Zach Dennis (@zdennis)
